str.o: Access files stored in a SQL database
Where the module will be mounted in the site's virtual file system.
The table that contains the files. The table should contain at least the columns 'name' and 'contents'. Optionally you can also have the fields 'mtime', 'uid' and 'gid'.

The charset of the contents of the files on this file system. This variable makes it possible for Roxen to use any text file, no matter what charset it is written in. If necessary, Roxen will convert the file to Unicode before processing the file.

The charset of the file names of the files on this file system. Unlike the File contents charset variable, this might not work for all charsets simply because not all browsers support anything except ISO-8859-1 in URLs.
